title: Track Awesome Network Js Updates Daily
_seo_title: Track Awesome Network Js (Kikobeats/awesome-network-js) Updates Daily - Track Awesome List
description: A :tophat: list of network layer resources written pure JS.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Jul 15, 2020
items.content_text:
### Modules

*   [mutex-server (⭐31)](https://github.com/samchon/mutex-server) - Critical section controllers, like mutex and semaphore, in the network level.
items.content_html:
Modules

  • mutex-server (⭐31) - Critical section controllers, like mutex and semaphore, in the network level.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Jul 06, 2018
items.content_text:
### Modules

*   [rpc-websockets (⭐613)](https://github.com/elpheria/rpc-websockets) - JSON-RPC 2.0 implementation over WebSockets for Node.js and JavaScript.
items.content_html:
Modules

  • rpc-websockets (⭐613) - JSON-RPC 2.0 implementation over WebSockets for Node.js and JavaScript.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Aug 27, 2017
items.content_text:
### High level

*   [hypervision (⭐450)](https://github.com/mafintosh/hypervision) – P2P Television.
*   [instant.io (⭐3.5k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/instant.io) – Streaming file transfer over WebTorrent.
*   [webtorrent (⭐30k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent) – BitTorrent over WebRTC.

### Modules

*   [airplay-server (⭐263)](https://github.com/watson/airplay-server) – A low level AirPlay server.
*   [castnow (⭐99)](https://github.com/xat/chromecast-player) – simple chromecast player.
*   [discovery-swarm (⭐376)](https://github.com/mafintosh/discovery-swarm) – A network swarm that uses [discovery-channel (⭐298)](https://github.com/maxogden/discovery-channel) to find peers. Also check [webrtc-swarm (⭐382)](https://github.com/mafintosh/webrtc-swarm).
*   [dns-packet (⭐212)](https://github.com/mafintosh/dns-packet) – Abstract-encoding compliant module for encoding / decoding DNS packets. Also see [dns-socket (⭐106)](https://github.com/mafintosh/dns-socket).
*   [etcdjs (⭐58)](https://github.com/mafintosh/etcdjs) – Low level etcd v2 client written in Javascript with failover support.
*   [geocode-wifi (⭐27)](https://github.com/watson/geocode-wifi) – Get yours latitude/longitude based on your wifi access point.
*   [hash-to-port (⭐34)](https://github.com/mafintosh/hash-to-port) – Hash a value to a valid port.
*   [hyperdb (⭐754)](https://github.com/mafintosh/hyperdb) – Distributed scalable database.
*   [ip-packet (⭐43)](https://github.com/mafintosh/ip-packet) – Encode/decode raw ip packets.
*   [magnet-uri (⭐227)](https://github.com/webtorrent/magnet-uri) – Parse a magnet URI and return an object of keys/values.
*   [network-address (⭐67)](https://github.com/mafintosh/network-address) – Get the local network address of your machine.
*   [network-simulator](https://github.com/substack/network-simulator) – Simulate a low-level computer network.
*   [rtsp-stream (⭐93)](https://github.com/watson/rtsp-stream) - A transport agnostic RTSP serial multiplexer module for Node.
*   [simple-peer (⭐7.7k)](https://github.com/feross/simple-peer) – Simple WebRTC video/voice and data channels.
*   [simple-websocket (⭐187)](https://github.com/feross/simple-websocket) – Simple, EventEmitter API for WebSockets.
*   [torrent-discovery (⭐218)](https://github.com/webtorrent/torrent-discovery) – Discover BitTorrent and WebTorrent peers.
*   [torrent-stream (⭐2k)](https://github.com/mafintosh/torrent-stream) – The low level streaming torrent engine that peerflix uses.
*   [udp-packet](https://github.com/substack/udp-packet) – Encode/decode raw udp packets.

### Protocols

*   [bittorrent-dht (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-dht) – BitTorrent DHT protocol implementation.
*   [bittorrent-protocol (⭐355)](https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-protocol) – BitTorrent peer wire protocol implementation.
*   [bittorrent-tracker (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-tracker) – BitTorrent tracker (client & server) implementation
items.content_html:
High level

  • hypervision (⭐450) – P2P Television.
  • instant.io (⭐3.5k) – Streaming file transfer over WebTorrent.
  • webtorrent (⭐30k) – BitTorrent over WebRTC.

Modules

  • airplay-server (⭐263) – A low level AirPlay server.
  • castnow (⭐99) – simple chromecast player.
  • discovery-swarm (⭐376) – A network swarm that uses discovery-channel (⭐298) to find peers. Also check webrtc-swarm (⭐382).
  • dns-packet (⭐212) – Abstract-encoding compliant module for encoding / decoding DNS packets. Also see dns-socket (⭐106).
  • etcdjs (⭐58) – Low level etcd v2 client written in Javascript with failover support.
  • geocode-wifi (⭐27) – Get yours latitude/longitude based on your wifi access point.
  • hash-to-port (⭐34) – Hash a value to a valid port.
  • hyperdb (⭐754) – Distributed scalable database.
  • ip-packet (⭐43) – Encode/decode raw ip packets.
  • magnet-uri (⭐227) – Parse a magnet URI and return an object of keys/values.
  • network-address (⭐67) – Get the local network address of your machine.
  • network-simulator – Simulate a low-level computer network.
  • rtsp-stream (⭐93) - A transport agnostic RTSP serial multiplexer module for Node.
  • simple-peer (⭐7.7k) – Simple WebRTC video/voice and data channels.
  • simple-websocket (⭐187) – Simple, EventEmitter API for WebSockets.
  • torrent-discovery (⭐218) – Discover BitTorrent and WebTorrent peers.
  • torrent-stream (⭐2k) – The low level streaming torrent engine that peerflix uses.
  • udp-packet – Encode/decode raw udp packets.

Protocols

  • bittorrent-dht (⭐1.3k) – BitTorrent DHT protocol implementation.
  • bittorrent-protocol (⭐355) – BitTorrent peer wire protocol implementation.
  • bittorrent-tracker (⭐1.9k) – BitTorrent tracker (client & server) implementation

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Mar 01, 2017
items.content_text:
### High level

*   [gun (⭐19k)](https://github.com/amark/gun) – A realtime, decentralized, offline-first, graph database engine.

### Protocols

*   [dht-rpc (⭐206)](https://github.com/mafintosh/dht-rpc) – Make RPC calls over a [Kademlia](https://pdos.csail.mit.edu/~petar/papers/maymounkov-kademlia-lncs.pdf) based DHT.
*   [dns-discovery (⭐194)](https://github.com/mafintosh/dns-discovery) – Discovery peers in a distributed system using regular dns and multicast dns.
items.content_html:
High level

  • gun (⭐19k) – A realtime, decentralized, offline-first, graph database engine.

Protocols

  • dht-rpc (⭐206) – Make RPC calls over a Kademlia based DHT.
  • dns-discovery (⭐194) – Discovery peers in a distributed system using regular dns and multicast dns.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Dec 18, 2016
items.content_html:
High level

  • hyperpipe (⭐119) – Distributed input/output pipe.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Feb 29, 2016
items.content_text:
### High level

*   [peercast (⭐519)](https://github.com/mafintosh/peercast) – Like peerflix but for Chromecast.
*   [peerflix (⭐6.2k)](https://github.com/mafintosh/peerflix) – Streaming torrent client.
*   [peervisionary (⭐42)](https://github.com/mafintosh/peervisionary) – Stream p2p content over your local network.
*   [peerwiki (⭐318)](https://github.com/mafintosh/peerwiki) – browse all of wikipedia using bittorrent.
*   [screencat (⭐3k)](https://github.com/maxogden/screencat) – WebRTC screensharing app.
*   [signalhub (⭐675)](https://github.com/mafintosh/signalhub) – Simple signalling server that can be used to coordinate handshaking with webrtc or other fun stuff.
*   [torrent-mount (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/mafintosh/torrent-mount) – Mount a torrent (or magnet link) as a filesystem in real time using torrent-stream and fuse.
*   [webcat (⭐452)](https://github.com/mafintosh/webcat) – pipe across the web using WebRTC.
*   [websocketd (⭐17k)](https://github.com/joewalnes/websocketd) – Turn any program that uses stdin/stdout into a WebSocket server.

### Protocols

*   [castv2 (⭐783)](https://github.com/thibauts/node-castv2) – An implementation of the Chromecast CASTV2 protocol.
*   [hypercore (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/mafintosh/hypercore) – A p2p network for distributing and replicating static feeds of binary data.
*   [ipfs (⭐1k)](https://github.com/ipfs/js-ipfs-api) – The InterPlanetary File System, a new peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol.
*   [k-bucket (⭐157)](https://github.com/tristanls/k-bucket) – Kademlia DHT K-bucket implementation as a binary tree.
*   [k-rpc (⭐76)](https://github.com/mafintosh/k-rpc) – Implementation of the k-rpc protocol used the BitTorrent DHT. Also see [k-rpc-socket (⭐25)](https://github.com/mafintosh/k-rpc-socket).
*   [mdns (⭐876)](https://github.com/agnat/node_mdns) – mdns/zeroconf/bonjour service discovery.
*   [multicast-dns (⭐524)](https://github.com/mafintosh/multicast-dns) – Low level multicast-dns implementation.
*   [peervision (⭐97)](https://github.com/mafintosh/peervision) – Live p2p streaming protocol.
*   [polo (⭐248)](https://github.com/mafintosh/polo) – A zero configuration service discovery module.
*   [rtsp-server (⭐32)](https://github.com/watson/rtsp-server) – A low level module for creating RTSP servers.
*   [utp-native (⭐103)](https://github.com/mafintosh/utp-native) – micro transport protocol, a network protocol similar to tcp that runs on top of udp.
items.content_html:
High level

  • peercast (⭐519) – Like peerflix but for Chromecast.
  • peerflix (⭐6.2k) – Streaming torrent client.
  • peervisionary (⭐42) – Stream p2p content over your local network.
  • peerwiki (⭐318) – browse all of wikipedia using bittorrent.
  • screencat (⭐3k) – WebRTC screensharing app.
  • signalhub (⭐675) – Simple signalling server that can be used to coordinate handshaking with webrtc or other fun stuff.
  • torrent-mount (⭐1.4k) – Mount a torrent (or magnet link) as a filesystem in real time using torrent-stream and fuse.
  • webcat (⭐452) – pipe across the web using WebRTC.
  • websocketd (⭐17k) – Turn any program that uses stdin/stdout into a WebSocket server.

Protocols

  • castv2 (⭐783) – An implementation of the Chromecast CASTV2 protocol.
  • hypercore (⭐2.7k) – A p2p network for distributing and replicating static feeds of binary data.
  • ipfs (⭐1k) – The InterPlanetary File System, a new peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol.
  • k-bucket (⭐157) – Kademlia DHT K-bucket implementation as a binary tree.
  • k-rpc (⭐76) – Implementation of the k-rpc protocol used the BitTorrent DHT. Also see k-rpc-socket (⭐25).
  • mdns (⭐876) – mdns/zeroconf/bonjour service discovery.
  • multicast-dns (⭐524) – Low level multicast-dns implementation.
  • peervision (⭐97) – Live p2p streaming protocol.
  • polo (⭐248) – A zero configuration service discovery module.
  • rtsp-server (⭐32) – A low level module for creating RTSP servers.
  • utp-native (⭐103) – micro transport protocol, a network protocol similar to tcp that runs on top of udp.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Jan 11, 2016
items.content_text:
### High level

*   [deejay (⭐127)](https://github.com/mafintosh/deejay) – Music player that broadcasts to everyone on the same network.
*   [dhtkv (⭐63)](https://github.com/maxogden/dhtkv) – CLI for storing arbitrary key/value data in the bittorrent mainline DHT.
*   [ipp-printer (⭐570)](https://github.com/watson/ipp-printer) – Create a printer on your network.
*   [wifi-triangulate (⭐70)](https://github.com/watson/wifi-triangulate) – Finds your current position on planet earth using the wifi access point.

### Protocols

*   [bonjour (⭐643)](https://github.com/watson/bonjour) – A Bonjour/Zeroconf protocol implementation.
items.content_html:
High level

  • deejay (⭐127) – Music player that broadcasts to everyone on the same network.
  • dhtkv (⭐63) – CLI for storing arbitrary key/value data in the bittorrent mainline DHT.
  • ipp-printer (⭐570) – Create a printer on your network.
  • wifi-triangulate (⭐70) – Finds your current position on planet earth using the wifi access point.

Protocols

  • bonjour (⭐643) – A Bonjour/Zeroconf protocol implementation.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Oct 12, 2015
items.content_text:
### High level

*   [airpaste (⭐825)](https://github.com/mafintosh/airpaste) – 1-1 network pipe that auto discovers other peers using mdns.
*   [blecat (⭐95)](https://github.com/mafintosh/blecat) – 1-1 pipe over bluetooth low energy.
items.content_html:
High level

  • airpaste (⭐825) – 1-1 network pipe that auto discovers other peers using mdns.
  • blecat (⭐95) – 1-1 pipe over bluetooth low energy.

items.title: Awesome Network Js Updates on Oct 11, 2015
items.content_text:
### Protocols

*   [airswarm (⭐132)](https://github.com/mafintosh/airswarm) – Network swarm that automagically discovers other peers on the network using multicast dns.
items.content_html:
Protocols

  • airswarm (⭐132) – Network swarm that automagically discovers other peers on the network using multicast dns.
